text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with beef tenderloin medallions
with caramelized tomato and mushroom pan
sauce so i'm not really sure if this is
an italian recipe but it is inspired by
those types of flavors but what I am
sure about it was really fast to make
super easy and really delicious okay to
start we're going to prep our second
most important ingredient the beef
tenderloin it should be fully trimmed
and ready to cook all right those are
four ounces each so I'm giving each
person two four ounce medallions but the
portion size is really between you and
your butcher so we're going to season
that generously on both sides with salt
and freshly ground black pepper and that
is prepped okay that was the second most
important ingredient now on to the most
important ingredient a high-quality
heavy-duty stainless steel pan and
you're going to see why that's such a
big deal in just a minute so I'm going
to put in a few drops of grapeseed oil
any kind of neutral high heat oils
perfect this is on the highest flame I
have and here's a little trick I like
take a little piece of scrap trimming
some fat and just rub that all over the
bottom it's a nice way to grease the pan
and it looks like you know a really
foodie thing to do okay when the oil
starts to smoke yes it has to be that
hot you're going to toss in your beef
medallions and we're going to sear those
for just two minutes per side
okay this gets finished cooking in the
sauce gently at the end so I'm just
trying to get a nice little brown crust
on there and again that's going to
happen pretty quickly so this was just
two minutes per side once that was
seared I'm going to turn the heat off
I'm going to remove the beef to a plate
I'm going to add a chunk of butter and
some olive oil to my pan and then we're
going to start the first of two very
important caramelize ations the first
we're going to toss in a handful of
mushrooms with a pinch of salt now
mushrooms are mostly water so that salt
is going to pull out the moisture it's
going to start to deglaze those meat
juices on the bottom of the pan that we
got from searing the meat and at that
point I want you to turn your heat up to
medium and we're just going to cook
those mushrooms until well browned so
what's happened here those mushrooms
have given up their water they've soaked
up that caramelized goodness those brown
bits from the pan and we're just going
to caramelize all that together to build
the base of this sauce and I'm going to
guess to say that's going to take you
about ten minutes you can even raise the
heat up past medium to medium-high if
you want to go
little quicker but you do want to brown
them at least until they look like this
okay you can even go farther if you want
at that point we're going to dump in
some tomato product any tomato sauce
basically will work
alright mine had a little bit of garlic
and basil in it and this is the second
caramelization and we're going to cook
the tomato with the mushroom until that
tomato just starts to brown onto the
mushrooms and again this is why you
can't really do this in a cheap thin pan
because you'll have hot spots and
there'll be spots that are singeing and
burning while the areas around it will
be not caramelizing so a really thick
bottom pan is important because all this
will Brown and caramelize at the same
rate and I'm going to go ahead and guess
that's going to take about five to six
minutes to do that
alright so you don't want it to burn but
a deep kind of brick-red Brown is good
you're developing lots of tangy flavor
that's going to balance perfectly with
the next ingredient which is some wine
some Marsala wine which is an Italian
wine it's a little on the sweet side
very delicious
you know we've used that in several
recipes before so we're going to pour in
a little bit I'm going to raise my heat
up to high and once it's almost all
evaporated and looks like that we're
going to dump in our stock now if you
have veal stock you are one lucky you
know what but if you don't chicken broth
works great I know it sounds weird but
beef broth doesn't seem to work as well
as chicken so that goes in and then to
finish this recipe very very simple
we're going to simply reduce this by
about half you can put the heat up as
high as you want I'm going to taste for
seasoning little salt and pepper all
right so that's looking good that's
tasting good and at that point we're
going to introduce the meat back in but
very critical turn your heat down to low
alright we just want to heat this meat
through we want to finish cooking it
remember we only gave it two minutes per
side so it's still rare inside so we're
just going to keep this on low keep
tossing it in that hot sauce and in
probably four or five minutes you should
have a perfect medium-rare now of course
you're going to cook it how you like it
I think this dish has to be served with
the meat pink that's just my opinion I'm
not saying that's right I'm just saying
every other way is wrong okay once I
determine my meat was complete and ready
to eat I removed it from the pan put it
on hot plates and then to finish our
sauce you know the drill
turn off the heat throw in a little
chunk of butter
you got fresh herbs use them I'm using a
little bit of fresh oregano first
parsley would have been great in this
give that a stir
keep it move in when the butter melts
you spoon it over the meat and let me
tell you this sauce is just out of this
world
of course buttery beef tenderloin is
always going to be delicious but when
you combine it with this amazing sauce
you are talking to die for like

course those savory earthy mushrooms
just a spectacular combination and
